availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund H. Parrish (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Father of Ed. H. Parrish. Married Virginia Briston Parrish in Winchester, Clark County, Kentucky April 1834. Farmer in Boone County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned 32 enslaved persons in Boone County, Kentucky in 1850. Married to E. A. G. Parrish c1860.Farmer in Scott County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned 20 enslaved persons in Scott County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned 20 enslaved persons in Scott County, Kentucky in 1860. Juror in E.H. Parrish ET Al to Thomas E. Bramlette in December 1864.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 351.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 968.Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 353.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 226. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film 00193687, p. 35. Find A Grave, "E.H. Parrish, Sr.‚Äù (November 16, 1805-July 3, 1876)," Memorial #101684559, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101684559 (accessed February 1, 2020). KYR-0001-004-1385.
